page.title: 16THE L.S.A.NEWBOURNE.
page.content: The Land Settlement Association was founded in 1934 to provide alternative work for unemployed from industrial areas and to give families with an aptitude for agriculture but little capital an opportunity to farm. Between l935 and 1937 the estate was developed at Newbourne. The original farm was partitioned into holdings. The old Elizabethan Hall was adapted as a temporary headquarters for incoming staff and stables and cowsheds were converted to stores, packing sheds and garages. Army huts were erected on the yard to house and instruct the trainees Fifty new houses complete with piggeries,glasshousess and poultry huts were erected.A new road was constructed the early trainees doing much of the work. The first trainees,mostly unemployed miners,arrived from Durham.
